articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Cape Verde
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Cape Verde
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Jorge Carlos Fonseca, president of the Republic of Cape Verde, on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the Republic.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Cape Verde would favorably develop, the message wished the president and people of Cape Verde successes in their work for the country's economic development and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK to Conduct All-inclusive and Comprehensive Probe into Japanese in Country
articles.content:
DPRK to Conduct All-inclusive and Comprehensive Probe into Japanese in Country
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK organized the "Special Investigation Committee" which will start an all-inclusive and comprehensive investigation into all Japanese residing in the DPRK from July 4, 2014 under an agreement reached between the governments of the DPRK and Japan.
					The authority of the committee is that it will be invested with  special mandate from the National Defence Commission of the DPRK to investigate all institutions and mobilize relevant institutions and persons concerned for the investigation any time when necessary.  
					
					The committee will be staffed with about 30 officials of relevant institutions including the Ministry of State Security, the Ministry of People's Security, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces,
					
					and people's power bodies of the DPRK and has the following four panels in Pyongyang and branches in relevant cities and counties in all provinces.
					
					 Panels include a panel for remains of Japanese, a panel for remaining Japanese and Japanese spouses, a panel for abducted Japanese and a panel for missing Japanese.
					
					 Branches will be formed with officials of relevant institutions including the Ministry of Security and people's power bodies.
					
					Key members of the special investigation committee are as follows:
					
					Chairman: So Tae Ha, counselor for security of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and vice-minister of State Security.
					
					Vice-Chairman: Kim Myong Chol, counselor of the Ministry of State Security 
					
					Vice-Chairman: Pak Yong Sik, department director of the Ministry of People's Security 
					
					Chief of the panel for remains of Japanese: Kim Hyon Chol, department director of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection 
					
					Chief of the panel for remaining Japanese and Japanese spouses: Ri Ho Rim, secretary general of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK 
					
					Chief of the panel for abducted Japanese: Kang Song Nam, department director of the Ministry of State Security 
					
					Chief of the panel for missing Japanese: Pak Yong Sik, department director of People's Security (He also holds the post of vice-chairman of the committee)
					
					Chiefs of branches: vice-directors of provincial, city and county departments of the Ministry of Security 
					
					 The committee shall operate under a well-regulated command system of the Center.
					
					 Not just one field concerned should be prioritized but all fields should be investigated in a simultaneous and parallel manner and the investigation will be conducted by way of holding interview, hearing testimony and touring the relevant field.
					
					 To ensure objectivity and transparency of the investigation, personnel concerned of the Japanese side will be allowed to visit the DPRK at a time deemed necessary.
					
					The orientation of activities of panels is as follows:
					
					- Panel for remains of Japanese 
					
					 It will take measures concerning various places where remains of Japanese are buried across the territory of the DPRK and conduct field survey and trial excavation on the basis of the existing information, testimonies, etc. and consult and take steps for handling remains.
					
					 - panel for remaining Japanese and Japanese spouses 
					
					 Confirmation will be made through register books of citizens kept by people's security institutions and relevant people's committees and through information provided by those concerned and hearing testimonies made by witnesses, and measures will be taken.
					
					- panel for abducted Japanese 
					
					 It will reinvestigate the abductees recognized by the Japanese government and confirm all records of each person from his or her entry.
					
					-panel for missing Japanese 
					
					 The entry into the DPRK of those who were reported missing and their identities will be confirmed by use of register books of citizens kept by the institutions of people's security while taking the information provided by the Japanese side for reference.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Vietnam General Confederation of Labor led by Vice-President Mai Duc Chinh arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Family of Chinese Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here
articles.content:
Family of Chinese Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Here
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, arrived here Friday on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Here
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Here
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Koreans in Russia led by Magai Anatoli, chairman of the Korean Autonomous Society for National Culture in Partizansk City, Maritime Territory, Russia, and An Hyang Jin, vice-chairperson of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia, arrived here Friday on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The family of Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Baozhong, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, Friday laid a floral basket before statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of the President and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and Koreans from Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Friday.
					 They were the delegation of the Oceania committee to commemorate the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung and the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il led by Co-Secretary General Raymond Ferguson, national secretary of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, and a home-visiting group of students of Korean high schools in Japan headed by Sin Kil Ung, principal of Tokyo Korean Middle and High School.
					
					 They placed bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Concert Given by School Youth and Children
articles.content:
Concert Given by School Youth and Children
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- School youth and children gave a concert "Song of Eternal Sun" at the Central Youth Hall on Friday to commemorate the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The concert began with immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Il Sung", narration and chorus.
					
					 Put on the stage were immortal revolutionary hymn "Star of Korea", the reading of the reminiscences and song, chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung", heroes' story-telling and song "Our Leader", female solos "I Wish to Meet the Leader" and "Photo" and other numbers.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the President who embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years and liberated the country by making a long journey of bloody battles against the Japanese imperialists and built the socialist paradise of Juche on this land.
					
					 Their repertoire included the story-telling and song "Song Sung by Blessed People", female chorus "Very Happy under His Care", cello solo and chorus "Ardent Desire", male chorus and chorus "We Are Happiest in the World". These numbers tell people the truth that the country has an immensely rosy future thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Among the audience were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned, those of the youth league, school youth and children in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered by Farmers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered by Farmers
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- There took place a remembrance meeting "The fatherly leader will always be with farmers" by the agricultural workers and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea at the Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District, Pyongyang on Friday on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present at the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of the union, officials concerned, those who had the honor of being received by the President, persons related to his revolutionary activities, agricultural workers and members of the union in the district.
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the Union, in his speech said that farmers would always remember the benevolent image of the President who visited farm fields again and again to make farmers lead a happier life.
					
					 Speakers including Ho Tok Bok, chairman of the Pyongyang city committee of the union, Kim Jin Guk, chairman of the South Hwanghae Provincial Rural Economy Committee, and Ri Chun Ok, lecturer of the Wonhwa Revolutionary Museum in Phyongwon County, recollected the traits of the President as a great man who continued his journey of dedication, even walking ridges between rice-fields.
					
					 Song Yun Hui, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City, Choe Jong Su, director of the Kosan Fruit Farm, and Ju Myong, director of the Sinuiju Chicken Farm, praised leader Kim Jong Il for devoting himself to bringing into a reality the behests of the President. 
					
					 Kim Myong Yon, chairwoman of the Management Board of the Jangchon Vegetable Cooperative Farm in Sadong District, and Jang Sun Jo, secretary of the party cell of the vegetable workteam of the Songhak Cooperative Farm in Anju City, also said that Marshal Kim Jong Un bestows upon them solicitude and trust, showing the same loving care just as the President and Kim Jong Il did, always considerate of the people's diet.
					
					 The meeting ended with choruses "Our Leader Loved by People" and "Our Leader Will Always Be with Us".

articles.title: Remembrance Meeting of Foreign Crewmen Held
articles.content:
Remembrance Meeting of Foreign Crewmen Held
 Hamhung, July 4 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting of foreign crewmen took place in Hungnam Port in South Hamgyong Province Friday on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They placed bouquets before the statues of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Hamhung City and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting attended by captain and crewmen of the Panama-flagged ship Sea Star 7.
					
					 The speakers said Kim Il Sung, who had embarked on the road of the revolution in his early years, founded the immortal Juche idea, led the revolution and construction to victory and thus performed great feats before the times and history. They went on:
					
					 The President's life was the most brilliant life of a peerless patriot who devoted his all to the country and its people.
					
					 He will always be alive in the hearts of not only the Koreans but the world progressive people.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Publications on Science and Technology Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Publications on Science and Technology Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's Central Information Agency for Science and Technology has published many magazines on science and technology helpful to building the knowledge-based economy in the country.
					 Among the magazines are "World of Science", "Technological Innovations" and "Information on Sci-tech Development in Foreign Countries".
					
					 "World of Science" deals with global trend and achievements in the development of ultra-modern science and technology.
					
					 "Technological Innovations" gives a summary of data about the technological achievements made in the country's economic fields.
					
					 "Information on Sci-tech Development in Foreign Countries" carries assorted data for various economic fields, selected from other countries' magazines on latest science and technology to meet the demand for the nation's economic and sci-tech development.
					
					 Besides, the information agency issues such periodicals as "Information Science and Technology", "Nano Science and Technology" and "Practical Technology Data",
					
					 Those publications can be read at the distribution offices across the country and through homepages opened by the agency.

articles.title: Long Afterglow Luminescence Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Long Afterglow Luminescence Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A long afterglow luminescence has been developed by the Nano Materials Institute under the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK. 
					 With no emission of radioactive rays, the long afterglow luminescence can reflect light for more than 24 hours after absorbing sunlight, lamp and battery light.
					
					 Easily adaptable to change of temperature and humidity, it is useful in making handicrafts, fine art pieces, porcelains, guides, night illuminations, etc.
					
					 Kim Mun Song, a section chief of the Institute, told KCNA that the long afterglow luminescence, made with locally available raw materials, has higher and longer emission rate than the existing ones.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Authors Many Works on Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Authors Many Works on Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung authored many works which served as guidelines for the struggle to achieve the country's reunification for several decades since the division of the country.
					 "Against the Elections of a Reactionary Separate Government in South Korea and for the Achievement of Korea's Reunification and Independence", "Report to the Second Congress of the Workers' Party of North Korea on the Work of the Central Committee" and other works disclose the U.S. imperialists' criminal moves to perpetuate the colonial rule over south Korea and indicate the principled stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and ways to do so.
					
					 "The Political Situation in North Korea", "On the Manifesto Regarding the Measures for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country" and other works deal with the issues of checking and frustrating the country-selling separate elections in south Korea, establishing the unified central government on the principle of democracy and reunifying the country in a peaceful way to cope with the moves of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet Syngman Rhee clique to ignite a war of aggression.
					
					 The President in his works published after the war provided a firm ideological foundation for the struggle to achieve the country's reunification which reflected the unanimous desire of all Koreans for aspiring after independence, peace and national unity and reunifying the country by the independent efforts of the Korean nation and a sure guarantee for victory.
					
					 The President also authored a work laying bare the ulterior intention of the anti-reunification forces to create "two Koreas" and calling for replacing the policy of national division with a reunification policy and the anti-communist policy with a policy for an alliance with communism if one is willing to have sincere dialogue and cooperation.
					
					 The President published "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country" in the last period of his life. The work is a review and an immortal encyclopedia of the President's  original idea of great national unity which calls on all classes and strata to achieve unity, putting  the common requirements and interests above all else in the struggle to achieve the nation's sovereignty and defend it and practical experience gained in it.

articles.title: Three Principles of Reunification Serve as Cornerstone: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Three Principles of Reunification Serve as Cornerstone: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) --  The three principles of national reunification serve as the cornerstone of Korea's reunification as they indicates the fundamental stand and way to successfully settle the reunification issue with the concerted efforts of the nation in conformity with its will and interests, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The three principles of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity clarified by President Kim Il Sung were proclaimed at home and abroad through the north-south joint statement on July 4, Juche 61 (1972).
					
					 The advancement of the three principles of national reunification helped the Korean nation dynamically advance the movement for national reunification along the road of independence.
					
					 In the last century, the north-south dialogue and cooperation undertakings gave all Koreans pleasure and optimism and the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration were adopted at the historic north-south summits. These are the inheritance and development of the July 4 joint statement as they were shining successes made in the struggle of the Korean nation to embody the three principles of national reunification.
					
					 In the course of implementing the north-south declarations, the inter-Korean relations driven to antagonism and confrontation entered into the road of reconciliation and unity to develop toward reunification during which the atmosphere of independent reunification, peace and prosperity ran high on the Korean peninsula. These historic facts were a striking demonstration of the validity and vitality of the three principles of national reunification.
					
					 The inglorious inter-Korean relations in recent years go to clearly prove that if one behaves going against the three principles of national reunification and the spirit of By Our Nation Itself, the inter-Korean relations will be pushed to distrust and confrontation and this will trigger off only war in the end.
					
					 Korea should be reunified on the three principles of national reunification and in the idea of By Our Nation Itself. This is the demand of the era and aspiration and unanimous will of all Koreans.
					
					 When the Korean nation usher in a new phase of improving the inter-Korean relations on the three principles of national reunification and in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself, a bright day of independent reunification, peace and prosperity will be open.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing Fair International Order
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing Fair International Order
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- To establish a fair international order is the unanimous requirement of the world people to live and develop in the independent, peaceful and prospering world, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The present era is the one of independence, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 No country and nation wants to see their sovereignty to be violated and to live, subject to domination and subjugation. However, there are not a few practices of openly infringing upon the independence of sovereign states in the international arena. This is chiefly attributable to the present unfair international order.
					
					 Under the present international order only the specified countries are granted priority and right to decision while other countries' will is ignored and illegal sanctions, blockade and aggression against sovereign states are justified.
					
					 This is a very serious problem as it is a factor of blocking the onward movement of the era and violating the independence of sovereign states.
					
					 The imperialists are now making desperate efforts to keep such international order and establish domination over the world by dint of the order. It is none other than the U.S. which is doing so.
					
					 It is the real intention of the U.S. to establish the international order guaranteeing its unilateral domination over the world.
					
					 If this is allowed, the U.S. will have the world to itself, bringing irretrievable grave consequences to international relations and development of mankind.

articles.title: S. Korea's Moves to Conclude Military Agreement with US, Japan Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korea's Moves to Conclude Military Agreement with US, Japan Assailed
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea at a press conference in Seoul on June 30 demanded a stop to the moves for concluding a military agreement that will escalate tension on the Korean peninsula.
					 The U.S., Japanese and south Korean military authorities are discussing a plan for sharing information on the north's missiles, the organization said, and continued:
					
					 This is required for the U.S. establishment of its missile defense system.
					
					 In case a MOU is concluded to this end, south Korea will have to offer information to the U.S. and Japan and get involved in their military operations and shoulder upon itself the financial burden.
					
					 The conclusion of the agreement will also actively back Japan's moves to exercise the "right to collective self-defense", a contravention of the UN Charter.
					
					 The south Korean authorities take an active part in the military alliance for aggression with the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 The moves for the conclusion of the military pact that will increase the danger of a military conflict between the south and the north must be stopped at any cost.

articles.title: Japan's Moves for Exercise of "Collective Self-defense" Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Moves for Exercise of "Collective Self-defense" Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- More than 70 civic and public organizations of south Korea including the People's Action for Realizing Peace against War and the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps held a press conference outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on July 1.
					 They accused Japan of mulling the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" by changing the interpretation of the Constitution with an aim to stage comeback to Korea, far from making an apology and reparation for its past crimes.
					
					 If Japan is allowed to exercise the right, not only the Korean peninsula but the whole of Northeast Asia will be exposed to the danger of a war, they held.
					
					 Intolerable are the Japanese government's moves to exercise the "right to collective self-defense" by changing the interpretation of the Constitution in a deceptive manner quite contrary to the desire of the world people for peace, they warned.
					
					 They voiced strong opposition to the moves of Japan to exercise the right under the patronage of the U.S.
					
					 They urged Japan to stop distorting the past war crimes and roll back its policy for the revival of militarism.

articles.title: Stop to Suppression of Teachers Union Demanded
articles.content:
Stop to Suppression of Teachers Union Demanded
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Vice-Chairperson of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia Ri Chae Son released a statement on June 29 denouncing the south Korean authorities' persistent crackdown on the Teachers Union of south Korea.
					 The statement accused the south Korean authorities of outlawing the Teachers Union that comprises the teachers of primary, secondary and high schools and depriving it of its legitimate status.
					
					 The union has conducted legitimate and righteous activities for the past 15 years, the statement said.
					
					 The south Korean authorities crack down on anything whether it is a legitimate political party, media or trade union if they regard it obstructive to maintaining their power, the statement added.
					
					 It demanded an immediate stop to the suppression of the Teachers Union.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Should Accept Special Proposal of DPRK: Koreans in China
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Should Accept Special Proposal of DPRK: Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China issued a statement on Thursday in support of the special proposal of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK to hold fast to the three principles of independence, peace and great national unity and usher in a new phase of improving the inter-Korean relations.
					 The statement noted that the special proposal is a patriotic one which should be put into practice and translated into a reality.
					
					 The present south Korean regime should accept the special proposal without any condition, it noted, adding:
					
					 There is no reason to fail to make a policy decision to completely stop all sorts of mud-slinging at the other side and totally cease all psychological and conspiratorial acts as was agreed upon between the north and the south at their high-level contact in February from the stand of giving importance to the nation and giving priority to it on the principle of independence.
					
					 There is also no reason to fail to totally stop all ceaseless military hostile acts in all areas along the line of confrontation including the hotspot waters in the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should make a bold policy decision in response to the special proposal of the DPRK and take a giant stride toward the new future with the will to resolutely break with the inglorious past.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Japan
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed in Japan on July 1.
					 The committee consists of Japanese personages from all walks of life, including Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 It decided to arrange a meeting praising the personality of the President as a great man and his leadership feats on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Nigerian Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Struggle Resolutely to Implement the Three Principles of National Reunification" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of KimilsungismÔºçKimjongilism on its website on June 27.
					 The work, published on July 14, Juche 61 (1972), underscores the need to make strenuous efforts to implement the three principles of national reunification and indicates tasks to do so.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Bulgaria, Switzerland and Sweden on June 26 and 28 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the feats of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on display were works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books introducing the true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 Atanas Ivanov, honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was the great statesman in the 20th century who made undying contributions to the sacred cause for the freedom and independence of Korea, the people's happiness and global independence.
					
					 He devoted himself to providing the people with a bountiful life, always finding himself among them, and made great contributions to the cause of national reunification and the cause of global independence till the last moments of his life.
					
					 Therefore, he is always alive in the hearts of the Korean people and progressive humankind.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, praised Kim Il Sung as the great father of the Korean nation and the eternal lodestar of Korea's reunification who worked heart and soul for Korea's reunification till the last moments of his life.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, noted though Kim Il Sung passed away, his desire, political line and leadership art are being steadfastly carried forward by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings in Switzerland and Sweden.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised in UK, India
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised in UK, India
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung took place in the UK and India on June 28 and 30 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on display were works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, said in his speech:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was not only the most outstanding leader and great thinker and theoretician in the 20th century but the brilliant strategist who beat down formidable enemies U.S. and Japanese imperialism in one generation.
					
					 He was the genius of creation and construction who built a socialist power on debris, though others claimed after the war that Korea would not be able to stand on its feet even in a hundred years. He was, at the same time, the father of the people as he regarded believing in people as in Heaven as his motto.
					
					 The progressive people in the UK recollect with deep emotion his noble career and undying exploits.
					
					 Balzor Singh Chauhan, chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung, said though he passed away, he was revered by progressive humankind as the eternal sun.
					
					 The DPRK is winning victories in the confrontation with the U.S. and making achievements in the building of a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar in the UK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- There took place events in various countries from June 25 to 27 on the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included a seminar and photo exhibition at University of Kinshasa in DR Congo, lectures in the Sogd Regional Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan and the hospital of the Ministry of Defence of Guinea and book and photo exhibition by the Party for Socialist Choice of Romania.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the exploits of Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were books and photos introducing the achievements made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK in building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo, said the President founded the unique Juche idea and successfully applied it to the revolution and construction, thus bequeathing the most valuable legacy not only to the Korean people but to the progressive people of the world.
					
					 Kurbonzyon Mirzoyeva, member of the Presidium of the C.C., the Communist Party of Tajikistan, noted that the solid political, military and economic foundation laid by the President has provided a sure guarantee for the steady victories of the DPRK.
					
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Party for Socialist Choice of Romania, said the President was the great leader who performed great exploits for the Korean revolution and the world socialist cause.

articles.title: Immediate Halt to US and S. Korean Forces' War Moves Demanded in Iran
articles.content:
Immediate Halt to US and S. Korean Forces' War Moves Demanded in Iran
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- The Iranian Workers' House issued a statement on June 28 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of the anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The statement said:
					
					 It is 64 years since the U.S. imperialists have provoked the war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' hostile policy toward the DPRK has remained unchanged since the ceasefire.
					
					 Their maneuvers to ignite a new war are getting undisguised day by day.
					
					 They have screwed up the military confrontation and tension on the Korean peninsula by staging large-scale war exercises with the south Korean puppet army every year, far from drawing a lesson from their ignominious defeat in the Korean war.
					
					 Consequently, the danger of a nuclear war is increasing on the peninsula.
					
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to bolster up the war deterrence for self-defence to cope with the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces' war moves.
					
					 The Iranian Workers' House extends firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defend the country and demands the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces stop the war moves against the DPRK at once on the occasion of the month.

articles.title: Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in UK
articles.content:
Meeting for Solidarity with Korean People Held in UK
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- A meeting for solidarity with the Korean people was held in London on June 28 to mark the June 25-July 27 month of the anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Present at the meeting were personages of the New Communist Party of Britain, Britain-Korea Friendship Association and other political parties and organizations and masses.
					
					 The representative of the Britain-Korea Friendship Association said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists invaded the DPRK with a wild ambition to stifle it and dominate the world 64 years ago.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists provoked the Korean war after misjudging the army and people of the DPRK, sustained the most disgraceful defeat in history and began going downhill.
					
					 The DPRK's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War represented a victory of the Juche-based military idea, strategy and tactics of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 His exploits performed for winning the war will go down in the world history.
					
					 Many years have passed since the ceasefire but the danger of a war has not been removed from the Korean peninsula due to the war moves of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces. 
					
					 All British progressive organizations should positively turn out in the movement for supporting the Korean people in their struggle to frustrate the U.S. and south Korean authorities' anti-DPRK war moves.
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain expressed belief that the Korean people would surely achieve the final victory in the showdown with the U.S. imperialists as they are led by Marshal Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward and accomplishing the cause of the President.
					
					 The participants watched a Korean film exposing the true colors of the U.S. imperialists as provokers of the Korean war.

Korean Film Shows Held in Nigeria, Guinea
 Pyongyang, July 4 (KCNA) -- Korean film shows took place in an agro-stock farm and a company of Nigeria and at barracks of the Guinean army between June 14 and 20 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of the anti-U.S. joint struggle.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Cabo Verde
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Cabo Verde
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Cabo Verde, Jorge Carlos Fonseca, con motivo del 39o aniversario de la independencia y la proclamacion de la Republica de ese pais.
					  En su misiva, el remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y el pais africano se desarrollaran positivamente y desea al destinatario y a su pueblo los exitos en sus trabajos para el desarrollo economico y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: ACNC informa sobre organizacion de CIE
articles.content:
ACNC informa sobre organizacion de CIE
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- Con respecto a la organizacion del "Comite de Investigacion Especial (CIE), la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ACNC) hizo publica el dia 4 la siguiente informacion: 
					Segun el acuerdo intergubernamental Corea-Japon, el gobierno japones decidio y publico oficialmente el 4 de julio que levantara las sanciones sobre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea,  cuyo contenido es la restriccion de viaje de las personas, la restriccion especial sobre la RPDC en cuanto a la remesa de dinero y el dinero portatil y la prohibicion de entrada en el puerto japones de los barcos de nacionalidad coreana a fines humanitarios.
					
					Desde el 4 de julio, la RPDC organizara el Comite de Investigacion Especial e iniciara la investigacion integral sobre todos los japoneses.
					
					El Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC inviste al CIE de la facultad especial de investigar todos los organos e incorporar a la investigacion a los organos y hombres correspondientes en cualquier momento y en los casos necesarios. 
					
					El CIE esta compuesto por el presidente, vicepresidentes, jefes de secciones y otros miembros necesarios y tiene sus filiales en las zonas correspondientes.
					
					So Tae Ha, consejero de seguridad del CDN de la RPDC y viceministro de Seguridad Estatal se encargara del presidente del CIE, y Kim Myong Chol, consejero del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal y Pak Yong Sik, director del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, tomaran el cargo de vicepresidentes del CIE.

articles.title: Organizado en RPDC Comite de Investigacion Especial
articles.content:
Organizado en RPDC Comite de Investigacion Especial
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- Segun el acuerdo intergubernamental Corea-Japon, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea comienza a partir del 4 de julio de 2014 la investigacion comprensiva y total sobre todos los japoneses a traves del Comite de Investigacion Especial (CIE). 
					El Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC inviste al CIE de la facultad especial de investigar todos los organos e incorporar a la investigacion a los organos y hombres correspondientes en cualquier momento y en los casos necesarios. 
					
					El CIE esta compuesto de unos 30 funcionarios de los organos competentes, incluso el Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal, el Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo, los organismos de las fuerzas armadas populares y el poder popular. Tiene 4 secciones en el centro y las sucursales en las ciudades y distritos necesarios de todas las provincias. 
					
					Las 4 secciones son las siguientes:
					
					La seccion de restos mortales de los japoneses, la de los japoneses que se quedaron en Corea y sus conyuges, la de victimas de secuestro y la de desaparecidos. 
					
					Las sucursales seran compuestas por los funcionarios relacionados de las sucursales del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal, los organos del poder popular y otros organismos competentes. 
					
					Miembros principales del CIE:
					
					Presidente: So Tae Ha, consejero para la seguridad del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y viceministro de Seguridad Estatal
					
					Vicepresidente: Kim Myong Chol, consejero del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal
					
					Vicepresidente: Pak Yong Sik, director del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo
					
					Jefe de la seccion de restos mortales de los japoneses: Kim Hyon Chol, director del Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental
					
					Jefe de la seccion de los japoneses que se quedaron en Corea y sus conyuges: Ri Ho Rim, secretario general del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de Corea
					
					Jefe de la seccion de victimas de secuestro: Kang Song Nam, director del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal
					
					Jefe de la seccion de desaparecidos: Pak Yong Sik, director del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo (Es tambien vicepresidente del CIE)
					
					Jefes de sucursales: vicepresidentes de las sucursales del Ministerio de Seguridad Estatal en las provincias, ciudades y distritos. 
					
					El CEI trabaja segun el ordenado sistema de mando del centro. 
					
					La investigacion se realiza simultaneamente en todos los dominios sin dar prioridad a un objeto o esfera especificos y en forma de entrevista con los relacionados o la escucha de sus testimonios, el recorrido por los lugares correspondientes, etc. 
					
					Para asegurar la objetividad y la transparencia de la investigacion, aceptara la entrada en Corea, en un tiempo necesario, a los hombres relacionados de la parte japonesa. 
					
					Cada seccion trabajara en los siguientes sentidos:
					
					- La seccion de restos mortales de los japoneses
					
					Tomando las medidas sobre las sepulturas de restos mortales de los japoneses distribuidas en el territorio de la RPDC, realizara el recorrido en el terreno y la excavacion experimental a base de los datos y los testimonios recogidos hasta la fecha, etc.
					
					Consultara y tomara las medidas sobre el tratamiento de los restos mortales. 
					
					- La seccion de los japoneses que se quedaron en Corea y sus conyuges
					
					Mediante el registro de la poblacion archivado en los organos de seguridad del pueblo y los comites populares y las declaraciones y escucha de testimonios de los hombres relacionados, confirmara la situacion actual y tomara las medidas necesarias. 
					
					- La seccion de victimas de secuestro
					
					Investigara de nuevo sobre las victimas de secuestro, reconocidas por el gobierno japones, y confirmara la trayectoria de cada persona, incluso la entrada en Corea. 
					
					- La seccion de desaparecidos
					
					Tomando por referencia los datos presentados por la parte japonesa, confirmara la entrada en el pais y la identidad de los desaparecidos a base del registro de la poblacion que disponen los organos de seguridad del pueblo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun aboga por establecimiento de imparcial orden internacional
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun aboga por establecimiento de imparcial orden internacional
Pyongyang, 4 de julio (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este viernes, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que establecer el imparcial orden internacional es la unanime demanda de los pueblos del mundo de vivir y desarrollar en el mundo independiente, pacifico y prospero, y continua:
					La actual epoca es la de la independencia.
					
					Ningun pais y nacion desea ser violada la soberania nacional ni vivir bajo la dominacion y la subyugacion.
					
					Pero, hoy en dia, en la palestra internacional surgen muchos fenomenos que violan abiertamente la soberania de los Estados  soberanos.
					
					Una de las causas importantes reside en el parcial orden internacional actual.
					
					El actual orden internacional da prioridad y el derecho a decidir a los Estados especificos y legaliza la ilicita sancion y bloqueo y la agresion contra los Estados soberanos despreciando la voluntad de estos paises.
					
					Este problema mas grave sirve de un factor que impide el movimiento de avance de la epoca y viola la soberania de los Estados soberanos.
					
					Ahora, los imperialistas se desesperan para mantener tal como es este orden e intenta tomar la heguemonia mundial considerandolo como  un medio.
					
					EE.UU. intenta establecer el orden internacional para garantizar su unico dominio al mundo.
					
					Al dejarlo intacto, EE.UU. actuara a sus caprichos y arbitrariamente en la palestra internacional, lo que traera una grave consecuencia irreparable a las relaciones internacionales y al desarrollo de la humanidad.
